title: The women fighting for Lapland
content: This video can not be playedAs climate change affects the livelihoods of Finland's indigenous Sami people, a proposed new Arctic railway, forestry and mining could change Lapland forever.Climate change affects the Arctic more than any other part of the Earth, and it's been damaging reindeer-herding and fishing - the traditional livelihoods of the indigenous Sami people.You can see more on this story on Our World: Fighting for Lapland which is repeated onBBC World News <https://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/n3ct5tcl> and the BBC News Channel <https://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/m00064lw> on Saturday 17 August 2019.Produced by Erika Benke. Camera: Antti J. Leinonen
